column4: hi. X11 keeps freezing. I can switch to a tty, and the underlying OS seems fine. I just can't seem to fix X11 without rebooting.
The only way I've found so far to fix it, is rebooting.
restarting the gdm service doesn't work?
that's no improvement over rebooting.
merely to aid in troubleshooting...
check ~/.xsession-errors, /var/log/Xorg.0.log, dmesg

dmesg showed up lots of wireless events, but nothing display related. .xsession-errors shows a few events of Failed to open VDPAU backend libvdpau_nvidia.so (but there isn't a piece of nvidia hardware in this laptop).. X.org.log.old (the one I was writing to when the problem occurred shows only one EE line, relating to the wireless mouse receiver during startup, but nothing more.
are you using unity?
no
what are you using?
Classic mode
this laptop has been running natty for a while, with classic all the time (apart from a couple of periods of experimentation)... this freezing issue only started occuring quite recently
any recent upgrades?
hardware, no. Software, when it prompts me. I installed a couple of softwre packages (a game that I haven't played since last weekend)
I'm just having a read of dpkg.log
and the freezes seem to happen randomly?  No common action you can think of?
they don't happen when I'm using it, it's a "when I come back to it" event

https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Debugging might have some hints.  My suggestion would be to try a different window manager to rule that out (I don't think it matters).  With classic, are effects still enabled?  Try disabling those to see if it still happens.  Given your last statement, is it screensaver related?
no screensaver, only dpms.
I'll just have to wait until it happens again to get some more info :S
make sure you check bugs.ubuntu.com too to see if others are experiencing it
I've not turned anything up yet
